sn4.9:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn4.9:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn4.9:5.1: “Mendicants, the life span of humans is short.
sn4.9:5.2: You must go to the next life. So you should do what is skillful, you should practice the spiritual life.
sn4.9:5.4: A long life is a hundred years or a little more.”
sn4.9:6.1: The Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha
sn4.9:7.2: A good person wouldn’t scorn it.
sn4.9:7.4: for Death has not come for you.”
sn4.9:8.2: and a good person scorns it.
sn4.9:8.3: They should live as though their head was on fire,
